headline: Salesforce earnings, JOLTS data, Fed comments: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime host Josh Lipton takes a look at the top stories for investors to watch on Wednesday, Sept. 3. Dollar Tree (DLTR), Campbell's (CPB), and Macy's (M) report quarterly earnings results in the morning. In the afternoon, Salesforce (CRM), Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), and American Eagle Outfitters (AEO) will announce earnings. In the morning, the US Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) will post the Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey (JOLTS) data for July. Economists expect the number of job openings to drop to 7.37 million from June's 7.44 million. St. Louis Federal Reserve President Alberto Musalem is delivering remarks in the morning, and Minneapolis Fed President Neel Kashkari will speak in the afternoon. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Accenture (ACN) to Acquire NeuraFlash to Boost Salesforce Capabilities
summary: Accenture PLC (NYSE:ACN) is one of the top tech stocks to buy now according to Goldman Sachs. On August 27, the company publicized its decision to acquire NeuraFlash, a consulting company specializing in Salesforce and generative AI (gen AI) solutions. However, completion is subject to customary closing conditions, including regulatory approval and required antitrust clearances. […]

headline: Cantor Fitzgerald Reiterates Overweight Rating on Salesforce (CRM) on Agentforce’s Strong Momentum
summary: Salesforce, Inc. (NYSE:CRM) is one of the top tech stocks to buy now according to Goldman Sachs. On August 28, Cantor Fitzgerald reiterated its “Overweight” rating and $325 price target for Salesforce. The firm cited Salesforce’s strong momentum with its AI-powered Agentforce product and the potential for a new pricing strategy to drive revenue growth. […]
